Division: Biomass
Group: Cultivated terrestrial plants for nutrition, materials or energy
Class: Cultivated terrestrial plants (including fungi, algae) grown for nutritional purposes
Class type: Crops by amount, type (e.g. cereals, root crops, soft fruit, etc.)

Division: Biomass
Group: Cultivated terrestrial plants for nutrition, materials or energy
Class: Fibres and other materials from cultivated plants, fungi, algae and bacteria for direct use or processing (excluding genetic materials)
Class type: Material by amount, type, use, media (land, soil, freshwater, marine)

Division: Biomass
Group: Cultivated terrestrial plants for nutrition, materials or energy
Class: Cultivated plants (including fungi, algae) grown as a source of energy

Group: Cultivated aquatic plants for nutrition, materials or energy
Class: Fibres and other materials from in-situ aquaculture for direct use or processing (excluding genetic materials)

Group: Cultivated aquatic plants for nutrition, materials or energy

Class: Animals reared for nutritional purposes

Class: Fibres and other materials from reared animals for direct use or processing (excluding genetic materials)

Group: Reared animals for nutrition, materials or energy

Division: Biomass
Group: Reared aquatic animals for nutrition, materials or energy

Division: Biomass

Class: Wild animals (terrestrial and aquatic) used for nutritional purposes

Division: Regulation of physical, chemical, biological conditions
Group: Lifecycle maintenance, habitat and gene pool protection
Class: Maintaining nursery populations and habitats (Including gene pool protection)

Stakeholders: Any (society at large) ; Conservation biologists ; Scientists

Division: Direct, in-situ and outdoor interactions with living systems that depend on presence in the environmental setting
Group: Physical and experiential interactions with natural environment
Class: Characteristics of living systems that enable activities promoting health, recuperation or enjoyment through active or immersive interactions
Class type: By type of living system or environmental setting

Actor_Subterranean-Freshwater: Living labs in Groundwater Dependent Ecosystems
Actor_Subterranean-Marine: Living labs in marine caves ; marine caves have been characterized "natural laboratories" or "deep-sea mesocosms" in the littoral zone because they provide direct human access to bathyal-like conditions within reach of scuba divers
References: Harmelin, J.-G. & Vacelet, J. 1997. Clues to deep-sea biodiversity in a nearshore cave. Vie et Milieu 47, 351–354.

Actor_Subterranean-Marine: Boat tours, snorkelling and scuba diving in marine/anchialine caves

Division: Direct, in-situ and outdoor interactions with living systems that depend on presence in the environmental setting

Class: Characteristics of living systems that are resonant in terms of culture or heritage
